title: VW Tiguan, Taigun, Virtus get up to Rs 4.2 lakh off on MY2024 stock
description: Volkswagen India has increased discounts on unsold MY2024 units of the Tiguan, Taigun, and the Virtus sedan. Depending on the variant, customers can avail of flat cash discounts, an exchange bonus, a scrappage bonus (they can’t be clubbed), and loyalty bonuses. What’s more, the brand is offering attractive benefits on fresh MY2025 units, too. Here’s a look at what’s on offer. Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to the availability of stock. Check with your local dealer for exact figures. Volkswagen Tiguan discounts February 2025 Save up to Rs 4.20 lakh Volkswagen’s flagship SUV is being offered with discounts in the range of Rs 4.2 lakh, which include loyalty bonuses, cash discounts, and other benefits like scrappage bonuses where applicable. The Volkswagen Tiguan is a five-seat SUV powered by a 190hp, 2.0-litre turbo-petrol engine mated to a 7-speed dual-clutch gearbox. This SUV is expected to be replaced by the all-new three-row VW Tayron SUV later this year. Volkswagen Taigun discounts February 2025 Save up to Rs 2.2 lakh Benefits on the Taigun have gone up from Rs 2 lakh to Rs 2.2 lakh this month for MY2024 units, depending on inventory. These benefits include loyalty bonuses, cash discounts, and other benefits like scrappage bonuses where applicable. For the new MY2025 stock, the brand is offering benefits of up to Rs 80,000 on most variants of the Taigun. Prices start at Rs 11.70 lakh for the entry-level 1.0 variant, going up to Rs 19.73 lakh for the top variant.  Volkswagen Virtus discounts February 2025 Save up to Rs 1.70 lakh For MY2024 Virtus units, discounts are now higher, at Rs 1.70 lakh, up from Rs 1.50 lakh earlier, depending on inventory. The newer MY2025 stock of the sedan gets benefits of up to Rs 80,000 on both engine options at most outlets. The types of benefits are the same as on Taigun and Tiguan. Prices for the Virtus start at Rs 11.5 lakh and go up to Rs 19.39 lakh. (All prices ex-showroom, Delhi) Also See: Kia Syros launched at Rs 9 lakh Ferrari 12Cilindri India price starts at Rs 8.5 crore

html:
VW Taigun and Virtus get up to Rs 80,000 in benefits on fresh MY2025 units.

Volkswagen India has increased discounts on unsold MY2024 units of the Tiguan, Taigun, and the Virtus sedan. Depending on the variant, customers can avail of flat cash discounts, an exchange bonus, a scrappage bonus (they can’t be clubbed), and loyalty bonuses. What’s more, the brand is offering attractive benefits on fresh MY2025 units, too. Here’s a look at what’s on offer.

Disclaimer: Discounts vary from city to city and are subject to the availability of stock. Check with your local dealer for exact figures.

Volkswagen Tiguan discounts February 2025

Save up to Rs 4.20 lakh

Volkswagen’s flagship SUV is being offered with discounts in the range of Rs 4.2 lakh, which include loyalty bonuses, cash discounts, and other benefits like scrappage bonuses where applicable. The Volkswagen Tiguan is a five-seat SUV powered by a 190hp, 2.0-litre turbo-petrol engine mated to a 7-speed dual-clutch gearbox. This SUV is expected to be replaced by the all-new three-row VW Tayron SUV later this year.

Volkswagen Taigun discounts February 2025

Save up to Rs 2.2 lakh

Benefits on the Taigun have gone up from Rs 2 lakh to Rs 2.2 lakh this month for MY2024 units, depending on inventory. These benefits include loyalty bonuses, cash discounts, and other benefits like scrappage bonuses where applicable. For the new MY2025 stock, the brand is offering benefits of up to Rs 80,000 on most variants of the Taigun. Prices start at Rs 11.70 lakh for the entry-level 1.0 variant, going up to Rs 19.73 lakh for the top variant. 

Volkswagen Virtus discounts February 2025

Save up to Rs 1.70 lakh

For MY2024 Virtus units, discounts are now higher, at Rs 1.70 lakh, up from Rs 1.50 lakh earlier, depending on inventory. The newer MY2025 stock of the sedan gets benefits of up to Rs 80,000 on both engine options at most outlets. The types of benefits are the same as on Taigun and Tiguan. Prices for the Virtus start at Rs 11.5 lakh and go up to Rs 19.39 lakh.

(All prices ex-showroom, Delhi)
